TITLE: Dow rises to new record, but Nasdaq falls nearly 2% as higher rates divide the market
Warren Buffett makes over $120 billion on Apple's rise to $3 trillion, among his best bets ever
SUMMARY: The 5% Apple stake Berkshire Hathaway acquired in 2018 for $36 billion is now worth more than $160 billion as the tech giant hit $3 trillion milestone.

TITLE: China launches app for its own digital currency as it looks to expand usage
SUMMARY: China's central bank has launched a pilot version of a wallet app for its sovereign digital currency in a push to expand its usage to more people.

TITLE: OPEC+ agrees oil output hike from February as omicron Covid cases soar
SUMMARY: Oil prices climbed more than 50% last year, with energy investors optimistic that the highly infectious omicron variant may be less severe than feared.

TITLE: CDC shortens waiting period for Pfizer Covid boosters to 5 months
SUMMARY: The CDC on Tuesday updated its recommended waiting period for people who completed their primary Covid-19 vaccination series with Pfizer's shots.

TITLE: Cathie Wood and China — ETF experts on whether these underperformers could make a 2022 comeback
SUMMARY: Cathie Wood's Ark Invest and Chinese stocks were two 2021 underperformers, but they could present a buying opportunity.

TITLE: U.S. reports over 1 million new daily Covid cases as omicron surges
SUMMARY: The U.S. also has the highest seven-day average of daily new cases in any country tracked by Johns Hopkins.

TITLE: One country is home to half of the 10 most expensive Michelin-starred restaurants in the world
SUMMARY: To find the most expensive Michelin-starred restaurants, the cooking website Chef's Pencil researched dinner tasting menus in more than 450 restaurants.

TITLE: Apple's wearable gadget business grew like gangbusters over the holidays
SUMMARY: This year is expected to be big for Apple's wearables business with the launch of a new augmented reality headset.

TITLE: New Zealand Covid experts take legal action against employer over harassment from public
SUMMARY: Two of New Zealand's top Covid experts are taking legal action against their employer, over its response to the harassment they have faced from the public.

TITLE: China to make some firms undergo a data security review before listing overseas
SUMMARY: China's rules, which will come into effect on Feb. 15, are aimed at companies that carry out data processing activities which could affect national security.

TITLE: European stocks hit record high, led by travel sector; Wizz Air up 12%
SUMMARY: European stocks hit a record high on Tuesday as the new year momentum continued in global markets.

TITLE: Jury finds Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes guilty on multiple charges in criminal fraud trial
SUMMARY: Jurors reached a verdict in the Elizabeth Holmes criminal trial after seven days of deliberations. They found the Theranos founder guilty on four counts.

TITLE: China Evergrande shares reopen higher; developer says contracted sales dropped 38.7% in 2021
SUMMARY: Indebted property developer China Evergrande's contracted sales plunged last year as the real estate giant struggled to repay creditors.

TITLE: Apple's rise to $3 trillion market cap shows the value of its massive share buybacks
SUMMARY: Apple spent $85.5 billion to repurchase shares in its fiscal 2021, and more than $467 billion since 2012.

TITLE: World's largest trade deal is in force, but there's still 'work to be done,' says Singapore minister
SUMMARY: The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership, or RCEP, came into force on Jan. 1.

TITLE: Tesla opened a dealership in Xinjiang, China, despite widespread reports of Uyghur oppression there
SUMMARY: Xinjiang is, home to a Muslim population known as the Uyghurs whom the United Nations and rights organizations have identified as a repressed ethnic group.

TITLE: Ford beats out Tesla to become the auto industry's top growth stock in 2021
SUMMARY: Ford accomplished this largely thanks to a leadership change in October 2020 from industry outsider Jim Hackett to auto veteran Jim Farley.

TITLE: Founder of crypto lending platform argues that bitcoin could hit $100,000 by mid-2022
SUMMARY: Bitcoin could see further upside and surge as high as $100,000 by the middle of 2022, according to Antoni Trenchev of cryptocurrency lender Nexo.

TITLE: Markets and the economy brace as the Federal Reserve's first rate hike could come in two months
SUMMARY: If everything goes according to plan, the central bank in a little over two months will enact its first rate increase in three years.

TITLE: Roofing giant takes on Tesla to make solar roof shingles more affordable
SUMMARY: GAF, one of the largest roofing companies in the world, just released a new solar shingle, which it says will be affordable and easy to install.

TITLE: Corporations, trade groups gave over $8 million to GOP election objectors following Jan. 6 riot, new study shows
SUMMARY: After the Jan. 6 riot, corporations and trade groups combined to give over $8 million to Republican lawmakers who objected to the 2020 presidential election.

TITLE: Morgan Stanley lists 4 reasons why China's growth could be better than expected in 2022
SUMMARY: China's economy appears to be bouncing from a "mini-downturn" into an upswing as the country eases policy, according to investment bank Morgan Stanley.

TITLE: FDA expands Pfizer booster eligibility to kids ages 12 to 15, authorizes third shots at 5 months
SUMMARY: New Covid infections have hit a pandemic high in the U.S. as the highly contagious omicron variant has supplanted delta as the dominant strain.

TITLE: 2022 will be the 'year of vaccination,' says director of vaccine institute
SUMMARY: Hopefully, 2022 will also mark the year when anti-Covid drugs will come to the fore, and make treatment more effective, Jerome Kim told CNBC on Monday.

TITLE: Chip sales are set to grow nearly 10% in 2022 as risks rise, predicts new report
SUMMARY: The momentum in the semiconductor space is set to remain strong going into 2022, according to a report by trade credit insurer Euler Hermes.

TITLE: A neuroscientist shares the brain exercise she does for a stronger memory — and the mistake that can 'harm' it
SUMMARY: Neuroscientist and psychology professor Dr. Amishi Jha says there are three critical things you must do to successfully remember something.

TITLE: Political change is coming to the EU's big three economies. Here’s why it matters
SUMMARY: The politics are changing in the EU's three biggest economies and this could have implications for markets.

TITLE: Dow jumps more than 200 points to record close to start 2022, Tesla boosts Nasdaq by 1%
SUMMARY: Stocks rose to start the year after the S&P 500 closed out a stellar 2021.

TITLE: Antonio Brown no longer a Tampa Bay Buccaneer, says head coach Bruce Arians
SUMMARY: Antonio Brown is no longer a Tampa Bay Buccaneer, says head coach, after the wide receiver left the field during Sunday's 28-24 win against the New York Jets.
